title: “Snow Swamp” on Lowell Glacier
description: Over a mere four days this summer, snow from the previous winter melted into a pond of slush on Canada’s Lowell Glacier. Mauri Pelto, a glaciologist at Nichols College, called the area of water-saturated snow a “snow swamp”. Read more on NASA.
theme:
FALSE – COLOR. Satellites show what human
eyes can't see
